sourceDesc.p: Converted from a Word document written by Nick D'Amore

list.item: convert those “,” things to just comma

body.p: “The shadow of these pads, seen (no at 3pm) a little one side, where the water is eighteen inches or two feet deep, are rarely orbicular or entire-edged or resembling the leaf, but are more or less perfect rosettes, generally of an oval form, with five to fifteen or more regularly rounded petals, open half-way to the centre: [image 1] or [image 2]. You cannot commonly refer the shadow to its substance but by touching the leaf with your paddle.”
PE 14, pg. 99 / 9 July 1858-9 November 1858 / NNPM MA 1302:33 / T vol. # XXVII / PDF # XVII / JXI
